parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To prop up, uphold, support, confirm, make stronger. From epi and sterizo; to support further, i.e. Reestablish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
To remain (abide) in, abide by, maintain, persevere in. From en and meno; to stay in the same place, i.e. persevere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
